Which monster do I unlock the fastest?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher DS Archive (DS): Monster Rancher DS: General QA: Which monster do I unlock the fastest?
By jamesccg on Sunday, August 8, 2010 - 12:03 pm:

I just want to know

By Thorr on Sunday, August 8, 2010 - 01:04 pm:

You can get Beaclon in your first year. Win the first Official Cup you find and you should still be in Summer. Go to the Beach errantry and you can get beaclon.

Nearly all other unlockables require breeder rank B.

By Dragon Trainer on Monday, August 9, 2010 - 05:27 am:

I was able to unlock the Xenon using a B lvl Dragon (Crevasse)...he had high lvls as this was a combined monster.

By GM on Tuesday, August 10, 2010 - 02:57 am:

About Beaclon, I sent my Hornie over to the beach recently and the Beaclon challenged him to arm wrestling. He lost, and Cleo demanded we both do a lot of log-pounding. He was 400 in Int, Spd and Ski, but 120-ish in Pow.

I tried looking for it four more times with my new Gadgeter G and I'm not seeing it. You think I need to send my old Hornie over there again?

By the way, how high was your monster's Pow when it became the Beaclon arm wrestling champion of the world?

By Thorr on Tuesday, August 10, 2010 - 05:04 am:

Mine was about 300-350 on my Tiger/Hengar. It was only class D.

About your Gadgeter G, were you going in the Summer like you were supposed to? Beaclon is one of the two unlockables that have a specific season. (Beaclon is Summer at the beach; Joker is Spring on the Road)

By GM on Tuesday, August 10, 2010 - 05:27 am:

I just went to the beach again in July with Gadgeter
G and August with my old Hornie. Beaclon didn't show
up. I wonder why?

By Thorr on Tuesday, August 10, 2010 - 05:35 am:

Yikes.... That doesn't bode well.

By GM on Tuesday, August 10, 2010 - 05:56 am:

I did some digging over at GameFAQs and it looks like plenty of people are having the same problem. Apparently, it simply changes its location from the western side to the eastern side, but I can't tell for sure.

I'll try again later.

By Thorr on Tuesday, August 10, 2010 - 06:27 am:

I -think- the book here says that if you fail, he moves to point number 2 on the map. Point number 2 is near the north-heading path on the eastern side. Head east from the start, then head north at the opening. the spot should be to the left of that path. (turning right would get you to the gravestone)

By GM on Wednesday, August 11, 2010 - 07:06 am:

I'll try again shortly.

In the meantime, didn't the guide mention anything about whether or not it's available every year, or every other year, or something to that effect?

By Thorr on Wednesday, August 11, 2010 - 07:50 am:

Now that you say that, it appears that the last sentence in the description on the map could indicate that you have to wait 2 years.

My rough estimate is that it says "If you fail, you must wait 2 years to try again." (if I understand the kanji correctly)

By Ichiro Tanaka on Saturday, August 14, 2010 - 09:58 pm:

Having exactly the same problem, my Pixie failed
to unlock Beaclon, so I started raising a Durahan,
and it's been three years and there's still no
Beaclon.

I had my friend read some Japanese sites about it,
and he found plenty of people responding to the
same problem. He said that out of 20 links, one
person said that if you fail the Beaclon event, it
will appear on the beach randomly later. The other
19 said that you missed it forever. I think it's
safe to assume that in the Japanese version,
failing the Beaclon event means missing it
forever.

We can only hope that they fixed this bug in the
NA version. I've given up for now, but I'm going
to try again in a few years while I wait for any
other solutions to this problem.

By GM on Saturday, August 14, 2010 - 10:16 pm:

return.

It's entirely possible that it disappears after you unlock the Magic
Spell regen method before finding it a second time, but I'm not
willing to throw away all my progress again just yet.

I started a new game yesterday. Luckily, I only lost five days of
progress and am currently raising a sun rank Hornie.
